text:
Hello,
 We are preparing to run upgrade our docker  validator on mainnet. Below are the planned steps—do you have any suggestions?
1. Wait for the supervalidator to restart.
2. Stop our current node running version 0.3.21.
3. Update the Docker image to Splice v0.4.0 (not directly to v0.4.1).
4. Restart the node using Migration ID 3 (instead of 2), with the `-M` flag on the first restart.

elements.text:
Hello,
 We are preparing to run upgrade our docker  validator on mainnet. Below are the planned steps—do you have any suggestions?
Wait for the supervalidator to restart.
Stop our current node running version 0.3.21.
Update the Docker image to Splice v0.4.0 (not directly to v0.4.1).
Restart the node using Migration ID 3 (instead of 2), with the
-M
flag on the first restart.

text:
Hello!
I've already configured a node in the devnet via docker-compose + auth enabled.
Trying to spin up the node in the testnet, got a problem that I believe due to auth.
Variables I've used:
audience: "<https://canton.network.global>"
authority url : https://<endpoint>.<http://auth0.com|auth0.com>

But my validator container doesn't start:
```validator_backend app initialization: Initialization failed, so exiting; check the application logs for details
java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Initialize app failed
	at org.lfdecentralizedtrust.splice.environment.NodeBase.$anonfun$appInitStep$3(NodeBase.scala:331)
	at scala.concurrent.impl.Promise$Transformation.run(Promise.scala:475)
	at com.daml.executors.QueueAwareExecutorService$TrackingRunnable.run(QueueAwareExecutorService.scala:98)
	at com.daml.metrics.InstrumentedExecutorServiceMetrics$InstrumentedExecutorService$InstrumentedRunnable.run(InstrumentedExecutorServiceMetrics.scala:190)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask$RunnableExecuteAction.exec(ForkJoinTask.java:1395)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:373)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.topLevelExec(ForkJoinPool.java:1182)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.scan(ForkJoinPool.java:1655)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1622)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:165)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: validator_backend app initialization: Wait for user failed
	... 10 more
Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNAUTHENTICATED: An error occurred. Please contact the operator and inquire about the request d81fd7fb6f6689562772ca43a6a2d257 with tid d81fd7fb6f6689562772ca43a6a2d257
	at io.grpc.Status.asRuntimeException(Status.java:532)```
In logs I can see that:
```{"@timestamp":"2025-06-19T12:33:57.619Z","@version":"1","message":"The operation 'Get user <correct-client-id>@clients' has failed with an exception. Retrying after a number of 112 failures, and after 3884 milliseconds. ","logger_name":"o.l.s.v.ValidatorApp:validator=validator_backend","thread_name":"canton-env-ec-23","level":"INFO","level_value":20000,"span-id":"8cfb2f789a056e15","span-parent-id":"ba036f7bcb2ac5de","trace-id":"56dc3cff53c8a35cc8aa067073c8db9a","span-name":"wait_user"}```
